abstract.p: A group of armed Arabs from the west attacked an unnamed town, killing the townspeople and looting the area. Two Christian men with bows and arrows attempted to flee the town. One ran while the other hid in nearby shrubs. The man in the bushes prayed to the Virgin Mary, promising always to commemorate her feast day if she saved him from the attack. Whereas the Christian who ran died in the attack, the man who prayed survived. Later, the man who survived became sick with dysentery on the feast of the Dormition. He prayed to Mary, and she healed his sickness.
